Setting Dialog Display Options

You can set which project or versioned file actions invoke a dialog box. For example, when you use Action | Get on a project or versioned file, Serena ChangeMan Version Manager can either display or not display a dialog box before processing the action. The dialog box lets you set options for the action.

The project and versioned file actions are:

  • Get/View
  • Check Out
  • Unlock
  • Lock
  • Show History
  • Show Difference (versioned file action only)

Using the Version Manager Default Options

Unless you or your Administrator has changed the default dialog display options, Version Manager displays a dialog box for all of the above project and versioned file actions.

Note: The check in action for both projects and versioned files always invokes a dialog box.

To set dialog display options:

  1. Select View | Options. The Options dialog box appears.

  2. Click the Dialog Behavior tab and do any of the following:

    • In the Project Actions group, select the actions that will invoke a dialog box.
    • In the Versioned File Actions group, select the actions that will invoke a dialog box.
    • To automatically close the results dialog box after the action is successful (so that you do not have to click Close in the dialog box), select the Automatically dismiss result dialogs when action is successful check box.
    • To hide the copy options dialog box when you copy items, deselect the Show Copy Options Dialog check box.

  3. Click OK.
